Articles.Content: After having seen 1.0, do you think SQUAD should make a 1.1 update to fix bugs and clean up the game?

During the 1.0 live-stream marathon, KSP devs would frequently be in the Twitch chats reporting that issues were being fixed during the streams, so I wouldn't worry about there not being a 1.1 (or 1.01 hotfix etc) to address issues

Features which couldn't be satisfactorily incorporated for 1.0 (like the dV for the VAB/SPH and engineers) were comfirmed to be coming in post 1.0 updates

As well as updating the underlying engine KSP uses to Unity 5

To aggregate commentary from Maxmaps; [Development is nowhere near done](http://www.reddit.com/r/KerbalSpaceProgram/comments/33eziu/i_feel_an_underlying_sadness_when_i_see_these_10/cqkd871?context=3), and there [plans to continue updates for the forseeable future](http://www.reddit.com/r/IAmA/comments/33ys4s/we_are_the_team_behind_kerbal_space_program/cqpochc?context=3)

> 
> After having seen 1.0, do you think SQUAD should make a 1.1 update to fix bugs and clean up the game?

I could be wrong, but it sounds like you're under the impression that 1.0 is the end of KSP development. Based on what Squad have said, you're completely wrong about that. They have said quite clearly that development will be continuing long past 1.0, ever since 0.90 and 1.0 first started to be mentioned.

1.0.1, or 1.1, or however they choose to number it, is a certainty. With the amount that has changed between 0.90 and 1.0, I'm expecting them to release a bug fix release in a matter of weeks to fine tune it and mop up any easy issues. If any serious issues appear, it could be in a matter of days.
